id: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised at the date of expiration
name: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised at the date of expiration

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC.

id: This ontology defines the various kinds of exercise conventions that are common to debt and options instruments. They are distinguished primarily in terms of the date period during which an optional contract clause may be exercised.
name: This ontology defines the various kinds of exercise conventions that are common to debt and options instruments. They are distinguished primarily in terms of the date period during which an optional contract clause may be exercised.

id: exercise convention that stipulates that an option may only be exercised at the date of expiration
name: exercise convention that stipulates that an option may only be exercised at the date of expiration

id: Under certain circumstances, early exercise may be advantageous to the option holder.
name: Under certain circumstances, early exercise may be advantageous to the option holder.

id: indicates a date on which an option may be exercised as specified in the terms of the contract
name: indicates a date on which an option may be exercised as specified in the terms of the contract

id: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised on predetermined dates until the first step is reached, but not after that point
name: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised on predetermined dates until the first step is reached, but not after that point

id: indicates a period of time during which the option may be exercised as specified in the terms of the contract
name: indicates a period of time during which the option may be exercised as specified in the terms of the contract

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: convention that determines when the holder or future holder of an option can implement the rights defined in the option
name: convention that determines when the holder or future holder of an option can implement the rights defined in the option

id: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may be exercised on or before the date of expiration
name: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may be exercised on or before the date of expiration

id: The Bermuda option is named as such because its exercise dates are more flexible than European options and less flexible than American options. Thus, it is in the middle, just like Bermuda is between Europe and America. Bermuda options are also referred to as Mid-Atlantic, Quasi American, or Semi-American options.
name: The Bermuda option is named as such because its exercise dates are more flexible than European options and less flexible than American options. Thus, it is in the middle, just like Bermuda is between Europe and America. Bermuda options are also referred to as Mid-Atlantic, Quasi American, or Semi-American options.

id: contract terms specific to the conditions, conventions and other stipulations related to the exercise of an option or entitlement
name: contract terms specific to the conditions, conventions and other stipulations related to the exercise of an option or entitlement

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to revise the definition of American exercise terms to say that an option with such terms may be exercised on or before the expiration date of the contract.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to revise the definition of American exercise terms to say that an option with such terms may be exercised on or before the expiration date of the contract.

id: exercise convention that stipulates that an option may be exercised anytime between the purchase date and date of expiration
name: exercise convention that stipulates that an option may be exercised anytime between the purchase date and date of expiration

id: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised on predetermined dates within some exercise window, often on one day each month or at the date of expiration
name: exercise terms that stipulate that an option may only be exercised on predetermined dates within some exercise window, often on one day each month or at the date of expiration

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to loosen the domain of hasExerciseTerms to allow for entitlements to have such terms.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to loosen the domain of hasExerciseTerms to allow for entitlements to have such terms.

id: links a derivative, such as an option or entitlement, to any exercise terms that are specified therein
name: links a derivative, such as an option or entitlement, to any exercise terms that are specified therein

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was added to support integration of Bonds and Options in SEC and DER, respectively.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was added to support integration of Bonds and Options in SEC and DER, respectively.

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the hasExerciseTerms property.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the hasExerciseTerms property.

id: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: ExerciseConventions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: call convention that stipulates that an option may only be exercised on predetermined dates until the first step is reached, but not after that point
